content: socks by allison rose repeat row 1 & 2 until there are 24 stitches left on your needles 12 on each needle ending on a round 1 kitchener bind-off the remaining stitches video tutorial for the kitchener bind-off finishing work pattern twice for the left and right sock weave in all loose ends and block socks to desired shape 6 january socks by allison rose abbreviations used k knit p purl st s stitch es m1 in this pattern when m1 is written you can use either a m1r or m1l whichever you prefer m1r make one right - insert right needle under the yarn between the stithces from back to front knit through the back loop m1l make one left - insert right needle under the yarn between the stitches from front to back knit through the back loop k2tog knit two stitches together decrease right leaning ssk slip slip knit - slip one stitch as if to knit slip another stitch as if to knit insert the left needle into the stitches and knit them together through the back loop decrease left leaning sl1wyif slip one with yarn in front - slip one stitch from the left needle to the right needle with the yarn held in front of the work sl1wyib slip one with yarn in back - slip one stitch from the left needle to the right needle with the yarn held in the back of the work ktbl or tbl knit through the back loop gsr turn german short row turn - knit up until the stitch where the pattern says gsr turn turn your work bring your yarn to the front and slip one stitch purlwise from the left needle to the right needle pull the yarn over the right needle and to the back of your work until you have created a double stitch continue to work as normal pm place stitch marker bor beginning of round slm slip_stitch marker from the left needle to the right needle mc main color - sample is knit with navy as the main color cc contrast color - sample is knit with white as the contrast color rs right side of your work ws wrong side of you work 7 january socks by allison rose
